maml:description.maml:para: Clone a version.
Clones a version of the CA set from the CA set specified by `-VersionID`.
Note that the clone may reflect expired certificates from the original. This function can use either `-CASetID` or `-CASetName` for ease of use.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
Your CA set's ID. You typically require this or the `-CASetName`.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
The CA set version's ID on which to perform the desired operation.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
A human-readable name of the CA set. You typically require this or the `-CASetID`.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
The CA set version's ID on which to perform the desired operation.

Expand CA set details.
This internal function is used to expand details of a CA set and isn't intended to be used directly.
A human-readable name of the CA set. You typically require this or the `-CASetID`.
Your CA set's ID. You typically require this or the `-CASetName`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).

Get an activation.

List CA set activities.

Lists activities on the CA set, sorted reverse chronologically with recent activities first. Apply `start` and `end` parameters to specify a time range. Specify only the `start` or `end` to include all activities after or before a given time.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
Your CA set's ID. You typically require this or the `-CASetName`.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
Filters out any activities before a given time, expressed as an ISO 8601 timestamp. To specify a fixed time range, pair this with the `-Start` parameter.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
Filters out any activities after a specified time, expressed as an ISO 8601 timestamp. To specify a fixed time range, pair this with the `-End` parameter.

Lists all versions of a CA set as identified by its `-CASetName` or `-CASetID`, or retrieves an individual version by its `-VersionID`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
If enabled, the response includes only the versions currently active on either the staging or production network.

Activate a version.
Activates the certificates for the version on the specified network. You can specify a CA set by its `-CASetName` or `-CASetID`.

Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The type of network to activate your CA set on, either `STAGING` or `PRODUCTION`. You should test on `STAGING` first.

Create a version.

Creates a new CA set version in the CA set specified by either `-CASetName` or `-CASetID`. You can provide the certificates for your new version either as a `PSCustomObject`, or a single file containing 1 or more base-64-encoded certificates, or point to a directory containing 1 or more certificate files. You can also add `-Comments` and allow SHA1 signatures with `-AllowInsecureSha1`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
By default, the version's certificates need a signature algorithm of `SHA-256` or better. Enabling this allows certificates with `SHA-1` signatures.
A human-readable name of the CA set. You typically require this or the `-CASetID`.
A folder to read individual certificates from. Files should contain base64-encoded certificates.
Any additional comments you can provide while creating or updating the CA set version.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
By default, the version's certificates need a signature algorithm of `SHA-256` or better. Enabling this allows certificates with `SHA-1` signatures.

A file containing one or more base64-encoded certificates.

Update a version.

Updates the settings for a specified version of your CA set. You can specify a CA set by its name or ID. You need to provide the `-VersionID` to update, but if you pipe the results of `Get-METSCASetVersion` this parameter will be read from the pipeline.

You can provide certificates either as a `PSCustomObject`, or a single file containing 1 or more base-64-encoded certificates, or point to a directory containing 1 or more certificate files. You can also add `-Comments` and allow SHA1 signatures with `-AllowInsecureSha1`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
By default, the version's certificates need a signature algorithm of `SHA-256` or better. Enabling this allows certificates with `SHA-1` signatures.
A human-readable name of the CA set. You typically require this or the `-CASetID`.
A folder to read individual certificates from. Files should contain base64-encoded certificates.
Any additional comments you can provide while creating or updating the CA set version.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
The CA set version's ID on which to perform the desired operation.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
By default, the version's certificates need a signature algorithm of `SHA-256` or better. Enabling this allows certificates with `SHA-1` signatures.
A human-readable name of the CA set. You typically require this or the `-CASetID`.
A file containing one or more base64-encoded certificates.
